translated: the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the forms of higher knowing, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are empty of inherent nature.

original: de ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: de ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
translated: They do not remain internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: they do not remain externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and they are not apprehended as being other than both.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: up to and including omniscience, are empty of inherent nature.

original: de ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: de ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
translated: They do not remain internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: they do not remain externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and they are not apprehended as being other than both.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: for these reasons,

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir mi gnas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir mi gnas so //
translated: All phenomena are non-abiding because of the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections

original: de ltar gzugs yongs su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs yongs su spyad par bya'o //
translated: should practice like that with form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnams shes pa yongs su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnams shes pa yongs su spyad par bya'o //
translated: They should practice with feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su spyad par bya'o //
translated: They should practice with the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i 'den  pa rnams dang / bsam @524b gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i 'den  pa rnams dang / bsam @524b gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
translated: They should practice with the perfections, all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the samādhis, and the dharanis.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
translated: concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su spyad par bya'o //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su spyad par bya'o //
translated: and up to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Then venerable Subhūti said to venerable Śāriputra,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so // tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how is it that you say,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su spyod pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su spyod pa yin /
translated: they are practicing the path to awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽there is a mundane perfection of generosity,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod /🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
translated: and there is a supramundane perfection of generosity.🔽There is a mundane perfection of discipline, a supramundane perfection of discipline, a mundane perfection of patience, a supramundane perfection of patience, a mundane perfection of diligence, a supramundane perfection of diligence, a mundane perfection of concentration, a supramundane perfection of concentration, and a mundane perfection of wisdom, and a supramundane perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod do //
translated: There is a mundane perfection of wisdom, and there is a supramundane perfection of wisdom.

original: smras pa / tshe @525a *//
analyzed: smras pa / tshe @525a *//
translated: Śāradvatīputra said,

original: dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang /
analyzed: dang ldan pa rab 'byor / 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,🔽what is a mundane perfection of generosity?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang /
translated: What is a supramundane perfection of generosity?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byed cing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byed cing /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings give gifts,🔽and as givers of gifts, they give to ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, travelers, and beggars who desire food,

original: sbyin bdag tu gyur pa dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / phongs pa dang / ltogs pa dang / 'dron pa dang; slong ba zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
analyzed: sbyin bdag tu gyur pa dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / phongs pa dang / ltogs pa dang / 'dron pa dang; slong ba zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
translated: food;

original: skom dang / theg pa dang / gos dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / gnas dang / mal stan dang / yo byad dang / sman dang; mi'i yo byad gzhan gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: skom dang / theg pa dang / gos dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / gnas dang / mal stan dang / yo byad dang / sman dang; mi'i yo byad gzhan gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ste /
translated: those who desire drink, vehicles, clothing, flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, dwellings, bedding, utensils, medicine, and any other human necessities, they give them all.

original: bu pho 'dod pa la ni bu pho yongs su gtong /🔽bu mo 'dod pa la ni bu mo /
analyzed: bu pho 'dod pa la ni bu pho yongs su gtong / bu mo 'dod pa la ni bu mo /
translated: To those who desire sons, they give sons.🔽To those who desire daughters, they give daughters.

original: chung ma 'dod pa la ni chung ma /
analyzed: chung ma 'dod pa la ni chung ma /
translated: To those who desire wives, they give wives.

original: rgyal srid 'dod pa la ni rgyal srid /🔽mgo 'dod pa la ni mgo /
analyzed: rgyal srid 'dod pa la ni rgyal srid / mgo 'dod pa la ni mgo /
translated: To those who desire kingdoms, they give kingdoms.🔽To those who desire heads, they give heads.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag 'dod pa la ni yan lag dang nying lag /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag 'dod pa la ni yan lag dang nying lag /
translated: To those who desire major and minor body parts, they give major and minor body parts.

original: sha dang khrag dang rkang 'dod pa la ni sha dang khrag dang rkang yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: sha dang khrag dang rkang 'dod pa la ni sha dang khrag dang rkang yongs su gtong ste /
translated: For those who want flesh, blood, or marrow, he gives them his flesh, blood, and marrow.

original: de'ang gnas shing yongs su gtong la /
analyzed: de'ang gnas shing yongs su gtong la /
translated: He gives while standing.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag ni yongs su gtong pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag ni yongs su gtong pa'o //
translated: He thinks, “I am the one who gives.

original: 'di ni len pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni len pa'o //
translated: This is the one who receives.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: This is the gift.

original: bdag ni ser sna med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni ser sna med pa'o //
translated: I am the one who is generous.

original: bdag ni sbyin pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: I am the one who gives gifts.

original: bdag ni bdog pa thams cad gtong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bdog pa thams cad gtong ba'o //
translated: I am the one who gives up everything I own.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: I am the one who does what the Buddha says.

original: bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o @525b zhes zer te /🔽sbyin pa de byin nas kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /🔽sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o @525b zhes zer te / sbyin pa de byin nas kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis / sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: I am the one who practices the perfection of generosity.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing /
translated: When he gives that gift, he makes common cause with all sentient beings and dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bdag gi sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dis sems can 'di dag tshe 'di nyid la bde ba dang nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gi sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dis sems can 'di dag tshe 'di nyid la bde ba dang nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur cig /
translated: “By the fruit of my generosity, may these sentient beings be happy in this very life, and may they attain complete nirvāṇa without grasping.”

original: ces yongs su bsngo ste /🔽de chags pa gsum la chags shing /
analyzed: ces yongs su bsngo ste / de chags pa gsum la chags shing /
translated: In this way they dedicate the generosity.

original: sbyin pa de yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa de yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: They give gifts while attached to the three attachments.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes pa 'di gsum la chags nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes pa 'di gsum la chags nas /
translated: Namely, attached to the notion of self, attached to the notion of other, and attached to the notion of generosity.

original: sbyin pa de dag yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa de dag yongs su gtong ste /
translated: They give gifts while attached to these three.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mundane perfection of generosity.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the mundane perfection of generosity?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags mi 'da' bas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags mi 'da' bas /
translated: Because it does not move out of, does not transcend, the mundane.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the mundane perfection of generosity.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the supramundane perfection of generosity?

original: 'di ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is the complete purification of the three spheres.

original: de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the complete purification of the three spheres?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings give gifts,

original: bdag mi dmigs /🔽len pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: bdag mi dmigs / len pa mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a self,🔽they do not apprehend a recipient,

original: sbyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a gift,

original: rnam par smin pa la'ang dga' bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la'ang dga' bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: and they do not delight in the ripening of that gift.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,
this is

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: the complete purification of the three spheres of bodhisattva great beings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: further, when bodhisattva great beings give gifts,

original: sbyin pa de sems can thams cad la gtong ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa de sems can thams cad la gtong ste /
translated: they give those gifts to all sentient beings,

original: sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs par /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs par /
translated: but they do not apprehend those sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing /
translated: and dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: mtshan ma cung zad kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba 'di ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma cung zad kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba 'di ni /
translated: and does not see even the slightest sign,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the supramundane perfection of giving.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the supramundane perfection of giving?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bas /
translated: It is because it moves away from, rises above, and transcends the world.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the supramundane perfection of giving.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod de /
translated: There are mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the mundane perfections?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims bsrung zhing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims bsrung zhing /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings practice morality,

original: de yang @526b gnas pas bsrung ste /
analyzed: de yang @526b gnas pas bsrung ste /
translated: and they practice it with a basis.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi don du tshul khrims bsrung ngo //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi don du tshul khrims bsrung ngo //
translated: They think, “I practice morality for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: This is morality.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin byed do //
translated: I am acting in accordance with the Buddha’s words.”

original: zhes bya ba nas; de 'di ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / tshul khrims su 'du shes pa dang / chags pa 'di dag gsum zhes bya ba'i bar la chags shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas; de 'di ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / tshul khrims su 'du shes pa dang / chags pa 'di dag gsum zhes bya ba'i bar la chags shing /

original: de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims bsrung ba'i tshe /

analyzed: sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing /

original: de 'di ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / shes rab tu 'du shes pa dang / chags pa 'di gsum zhes bya ba'i bar la chags shing /
analyzed: de 'di ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / shes rab tu 'du shes pa dang / chags pa 'di gsum zhes bya ba'i bar la chags shing /
translated: ‘I am attached to these three: the perception of self, the perception of others, and the perception of wisdom.

original: shes rab bsgom ste; 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab bsgom ste; 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mundane perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the mundane perfection of wisdom?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags mi 'da' bas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags mi 'da' bas /
translated: Because it does not transcend, rise above, or go beyond the mundane.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called mundane.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supramundane perfection of wisdom?🔽It is the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: 'di ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste; de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste; de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the complete purity of the three spheres?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom @529b pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom @529b pa'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings cultivate the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdag mi dmigs /
analyzed: bdag mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a self,

original: sems can mi dmigs /
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a sentient being,

original: shes rab mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend wisdom,

original: rnam par smin pa la'ang dga' bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la'ang dga' bar mi byed cing /
translated: and they do not delight in its ripening.

original: shes rab de'ang sems can thams cad la gtong ste; sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing /
analyzed: shes rab de'ang sems can thams cad la gtong ste; sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo zhing /
translated: They give that wisdom to all sentient beings, and they dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening without apprehending those sentient beings.

original: mtshan ma cung zad kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba 'di ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma cung zad kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba 'di ni /
translated: They do not see even the slightest sign.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the supramundane perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' bas /
translated: It is so called because it transcends, is exalted above, and passes beyond the world.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called supramundane.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: in this way, bodhisattva great beings, practicing the six perfections,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: are purifying the path to awakening.🔽Śāradvatīputra said,

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin /
translated: what is the path to awakening of bodhisattva great beings?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: the perfection of generosity is the path to awakening of bodhisattva great beings.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a @530a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a @530a *//
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: nang stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //🔽phyi stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo // phyi stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.🔽The emptiness of external phenomena is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: The emptiness of both external and internal phenomena is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi ni /
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: are the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: The four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of awakening, and the noble eightfold path are the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni /
translated: the four noble truths

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: are the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs @530b kyi sgo thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs @530b kyi sgo thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: wishlessness, the five higher perceptions, all the meditative stabilizations, and all the dhāraṇī gateways are the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: The ten tathāgata powers are the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: The four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor //
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor //
translated: Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: it is excellent, excellent that you have asked the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: byang chub kyi lam 'di pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi mthu yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam 'di pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi mthu yin /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this path to awakening is the power of which perfections?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa; tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa; tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu ste /
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu ste /
translated: it is the power of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad bskyed pa'o //
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom gives rise to the dharmas of the śrāvakas, the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the buddhas, and all wholesome dharmas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su sdud cing yang dag par sdud pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su sdud cing yang dag par sdud pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom gathers and truly gathers the dharmas of the śrāvakas, the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the buddhas, and all wholesome dharmas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @531a *//
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @531a *//
translated: the past tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas also practiced this perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di la spyad de /
analyzed: 'di la spyad de /
translated: and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: they have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang /
translated: the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas of the future

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyod cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyod cing /
translated: will also practice this very perfection of wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,🔽the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas🔽who are now present in the world systems of the ten directions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag gis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag gis kyang /
translated: protecting, keeping, and maintaining,🔽they too, Venerable Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad de /
translated: will also practice this very perfection of wisdom🔽and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: and fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: if, when the perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nem nur ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nem nur ram /
translated: a bodhisattva great being does not doubt

original: rmongs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rmongs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: or become confused,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'di ltar sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'di ltar sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba'i phyir /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽you should know that bodhisattva great being,🔽through this practice, practices with that practice,

analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par spyod pa 'dis rnam par spyod par shes par bya'o //
translated: that is, for the sake of protecting all sentient beings and not abandoning all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @531b de ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @531b de ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: You should know that bodhisattva great being🔽is not separated from that attention,

analyzed: snying rje chen po yid la bya ba'i yid la bya ba de dang ma bral bar shes par bya'o //

analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /

analyzed: rnam par spyod pa 'dis rnam par spyod cing / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: snying rje chen po yid la bya ba'i yid la bya ba de dang ma bral bas /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen por 'dod na /

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ro //
translated: all sentient beings would be bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: sems can thams cad kyang yid la bya ba dang ni ma bral lo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang yid la bya ba dang ni ma bral lo //
translated: all sentient beings are not separated from attention.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: excellent, excellent!

original: dri'o dri'o snyam pa'i don de nyid tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pas yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: dri'o dri'o snyam pa'i don de nyid tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pas yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: The meaning that you have thought about and thought about again, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, is well grasped by you with correct words.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,
