analyzed: sems can med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there are no sentient beings,

original: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //🔽sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o // sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that there is no mental activity.🔽Because sentient beings are unreal, one should know that mental activity is unreal.

original: sems can rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because sentient beings are essenceless, one should know that mental activity is essenceless.

original: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because sentient beings are empty, one should know that mental activity is empty.

original: sems can dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because sentient beings are isolated, one should know that mental activity is isolated.

original: sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Because sentient beings do not fully awaken, one should know that mental activity does not fully awaken.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i @532a *//🔽bu; gzugs med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i @532a *// bu; gzugs med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽because form does not exist, one should know that mental activity does not exist.

original: gzugs dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because form is unreal, one should know that mental activity is unreal.

original: gzugs rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //🔽gzugs stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o // gzugs stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because form is essenceless, you should know that attention is essenceless.🔽Because form is empty, you should know that attention is empty.

original: gzugs dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because form is isolated, you should know that attention is isolated.

original: gzugs mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because form does not fully awaken to enlightenment,

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that attention does not fully awaken to enlightenment.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //🔽rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o // rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not exist, you should know that attention does not exist.🔽Because consciousness is not a thing, you should know that attention is not a thing.

original: rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because consciousness is essenceless, you should know that attention is essenceless.

original: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: because consciousness is empty, mental activity should be understood to be empty;🔽because consciousness is isolated, mental activity should be understood to be isolated;🔽because consciousness is unarisen, mental activity should be understood to be unarisen;

original: rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //🔽rnam par shes pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o // rnam par shes pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: because consciousness is unproduced, mental activity should be understood to be unproduced;🔽because consciousness is unapprehendable, mental activity should be understood to be unapprehendable;🔽because consciousness is unobtainable, mental activity should be understood to be unobtainable;🔽because consciousness is non-existent, mental activity should be understood to be non-existent;🔽because consciousness is not real, mental activity should be understood to be not real;🔽because consciousness is not a thing, mental activity should be understood to be not a thing;🔽because consciousness is not a non-thing, mental activity should be understood to be not a non-thing;🔽because consciousness is not produced, mental activity should be understood to be not produced;🔽because consciousness is not destroyed, mental activity should be understood to be not destroyed;🔽because consciousness is not defiled, mental activity should be understood to be not defiled;🔽because consciousness is not purified, mental activity should be understood to be not purified;🔽because consciousness is not diminished, mental activity should be understood to be not diminished;

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: because consciousness is not increased, mental activity should be understood to be not increased;🔽because consciousness is not internal, mental activity should be understood to be not internal;🔽because consciousness is not external, mental activity should be understood to be not external;🔽because consciousness is not something to be appropriated, mental activity should be understood to be not something to be appropriated;🔽because consciousness is not something to be abandoned, mental activity should be understood to be not something to be abandoned;

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung @532b pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung @532b pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: because consciousness is not something to be counteracted, mental activity should be understood to be not something to be counteracted;🔽because consciousness is not something to be purified, mental activity should be understood to be not something to be purified;🔽because consciousness is not something to be manifested, mental activity should be understood to be not something to be manifested;🔽because consciousness is not something to be directly perceived, mental activity should be understood to be not something to be directly perceived;

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: because consciousness is not something to be realized, mental activity should be understood to be not something to be realized;🔽because consciousness is not something to be known, mental activity should be understood to be not something to be known;

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is emptiness because of the emptiness of dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: You should know that mental activity is isolated because of the isolation of dependent origination.

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is not fully awakened because of the non-full-awakening of dependent origination.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽you should know that mental activity is non-existent because of the non-existence of the perfection of generosity.🔽You should know that mental activity is non-existent because of the non-existence of the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is without intrinsic nature because of the absence of intrinsic nature in the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that attention is emptiness because the perfection of generosity is emptiness.🔽You should know that attention is isolated because the perfection of generosity is isolated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽tshul khrims kyi pha @533a *//
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / tshul khrims kyi pha @533a *//
translated: You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.

original: rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated because the perfection of generosity is not something that can be appropriated.🔽You should know that attention is not something that can be appropriated

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is non-existent because the perfection of wisdom is non-existent.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is essenceless because the perfection of wisdom is essenceless.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is emptiness because the perfection of wisdom is emptiness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is isolated because the perfection of wisdom is isolated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity does not fully awaken because the perfection of wisdom does not fully awaken.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: nang stong pa nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity is non-existent because inner emptiness is non-existent.

original: nang stong pa nyid dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //🔽nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o // nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because inner emptiness is not a thing, you should know that mental activity is not a thing.🔽Because inner emptiness is essenceless, you should know that mental activity is essenceless.

original: nang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because inner emptiness is empty, you should know that mental activity is empty.

original: nang stong pa nyid dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because inner emptiness is isolated, you should know that mental activity is isolated.

original: nang stong pa nyid mngon @533b par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid mngon @533b par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Because inner emptiness does not fully awaken, you should know that mental activity does not fully awaken.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: because up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature does not exist, you should know that mental activity does not exist.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities should be known as non-existent because of the non-existence of entities.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of an essential nature should be known as the absence of an essential nature because of the absence of an essential nature of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Emptiness should be known as emptiness because of the emptiness of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: Isolation should be known as isolation because of the isolation of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of a basic nature should be known as the absence of a basic nature because of the absence of a basic nature of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of arising should be known as the absence of arising because of the absence of arising of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of cessation should be known as the absence of cessation because of the absence of cessation of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: The absence of purity should be known as the absence of purity because of the absence of purity of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of affliction should be known as the absence of affliction because of the absence of affliction of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of entities should be known as the absence of entities because of the absence of entities of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of non-entities should be known as the absence of non-entities because of the absence of non-entities of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of arising should be known as the absence of arising because of the absence of arising of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: The absence of cessation should be known as the absence of cessation because of the absence of cessation of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of purity should be known as the absence of purity because of the absence of purity of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of affliction should be known as the absence of affliction because of the absence of affliction of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽The absence of entities should be known as the absence of entities because of the absence of entities of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The absence of non-entities should be known as the absence of non-entities because

original: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is non-existent.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the applications of mindfulness are non-existent,

original: yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity is non-existent.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because the applications of mindfulness are essenceless, you should know that mental activity is essenceless.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the applications of mindfulness are empty,

original: yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity is empty.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dben @534a *//
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dben @534a *//
translated: Because the applications of mindfulness are isolated,

original: pa'i phyir / yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir / yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity is isolated.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the applications of mindfulness do not fully awaken,

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity does not fully awaken.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and noble eightfold path do not exist.

original: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is nonexistent.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the noble eightfold path is not a thing,

original: yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity is not a thing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the noble eightfold path is essenceless,

original: yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity is essenceless.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the noble eightfold path is empty,

original: yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity is empty.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dben pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dben pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the noble eightfold path is isolated,

original: yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that mental activity is isolated.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: “You should know that the eightfold noble path is not awakened to,🔽and that mental activity is not awakened to.

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o; ;'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa @534b rnams dang /
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o; ;'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa @534b rnams dang /
translated: The four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten tathāgata powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the four assurances, the four unhindered knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha do not exist,

original: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be known that mental activity does not exist.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the distinct attributes of a buddha are not something that can be appropriated,

original: yid la byed dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be known that mental activity is not something that can be appropriated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the distinct attributes of a buddha are not a real ,

original: yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be known that mental activity is not a real .🔽Because the distinct attributes of a buddha are empty,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir; yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir; yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be known that mental activity is empty.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dben pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dben pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the distinct attributes of a buddha are isolated,

original: yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be known that mental activity is isolated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the distinct attributes of a buddha do not fully awaken,

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that mental activity is not fully awakened.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub kyi bar du med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o // byang chub dngos po med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dngos po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: because awakening does not exist, one should know that mental activity does not exist.🔽Because awakening is not a thing, one should know that mental activity is not a thing.

original: byang chub rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid @535a *//🔽la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yid @535a *// la byed pa rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because awakening is essenceless, one should know that mental activity is essenceless.

original: byang chub stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because awakening is empty, one should know that mental activity is empty.

original: byang chub dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Because awakening is isolated, one should know that mental activity is isolated.

original: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because awakening is not fully awakened,🔽one should know that mental activity is not fully awakened.

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o; ;tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o; ;tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnam grangs des na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: For this reason,🔽Subhūti,

original: snying rje chen po yid la byed pa nyid dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po yid la byed pa nyid dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings should be known as never separated from the attention of great compassion.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces legs so //🔽zhes bya ba gnang ste /🔽rab 'byor / legs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces legs so // zhes bya ba gnang ste / rab 'byor / legs so //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti, “Excellent, Subhūti, excellent!

original: legs so // de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus /
analyzed: legs so // de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus /
translated: Subhūti, it is excellent, excellent, that you have taught the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings in this way through the power of the Tathāgata.

original: rab 'byor khyod ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod ji ltar ston pa de bzhin du /
translated: Subhūti, just as you have taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom should be taught to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: And just as you have taught, the bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa'i tshe /
translated: When this chapter, “The Perfection of Wisdom,” was being taught,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos te /🔽g-yos so // rab tu g-yos @535b so; ;kun tu g-yos so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos te / g-yos so // rab tu g-yos @535b so; ;kun tu g-yos so //
translated: This trichiliocosm shook in six ways:🔽it shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely;

original: 'gul to // rab tu 'gul to //🔽kun tu 'gul to //
analyzed: 'gul to // rab tu 'gul to // kun tu 'gul to //
translated: it quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;🔽it trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;

original: ldeg go / rab tu ldeg go /🔽kun tu ldeg go /🔽chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
analyzed: ldeg go / rab tu ldeg go / kun tu ldeg go / chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
translated: it quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely;🔽it roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely;

original: kun tu chem chem mo //🔽'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: kun tu chem chem mo // 'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: it rumbled, rumbled strongly, and rumbled intensely;

original: kun tu 'ur 'ur ro //🔽shar phyogs dma' bar gyur na nub phyogs mtho bar gyur to //
analyzed: kun tu 'ur 'ur ro // shar phyogs dma' bar gyur na nub phyogs mtho bar gyur to //
translated: it crashed, crashed strongly, and crashed intensely.🔽The east sank and the west rose;

original: shar phyogs mtho bar gyur na nub phyogs dma' bar gyur to //🔽byang phyogs dma' bar gyur na lho phyogs mtho bar gyur to //
analyzed: shar phyogs mtho bar gyur na nub phyogs dma' bar gyur to // byang phyogs dma' bar gyur na lho phyogs mtho bar gyur to //
translated: the west sank and the east rose;🔽the north sank and the south rose;

original: lho phyogs dma' bar gyur na byang phyogs mtho bar gyur to //🔽dbus dma' bar gyur na mtha' mtho bar gyur to //
analyzed: lho phyogs dma' bar gyur na byang phyogs mtho bar gyur to // dbus dma' bar gyur na mtha' mtho bar gyur to //
translated: the south sank and the north rose;🔽the center sank and the periphery rose;

original: mtha' dma' bar gyur na dbus mtho bar gyur to //
analyzed: mtha' dma' bar gyur na dbus mtho bar gyur to //
translated: the periphery sank and the center rose.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Lord smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said this to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis 'dzum pa mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis 'dzum pa mdzad /
translated: what is the cause, what is the reason for your smile?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: ” The Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar nga 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar nga 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de bzhin du /
translated: “Subhūti, just as I am teaching the perfection of wisdom in this Sahā world system,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na'ang /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems @536a *//
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na'ang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems @536a *//
translated: so also in immeasurable, countless world systems in the eastern direction

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ston pa mdzad do //
translated: the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas are teaching just this perfection of wisdom to bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar nga 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar nga 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de bzhin du /
translated: “Subhūti, just as I teach the perfection of wisdom in this Sahā world system,

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na'ang /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na'ang /
translated: so too in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, northwestern, lower, and upper directions, in each of the world systems,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams /
translated: the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ston pa mdzad do //
translated: teach just this perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: When this teaching of the perfection of wisdom was being given,

original: lha dang mi'i skye dgu khrag khrig phrag bcu gnyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye dgu khrag khrig phrag bcu gnyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
translated: 12 trillion beings of the classes of gods and humans gave rise to acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: phyogs bcu kun tu 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis /
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun tu 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis /
translated: In all the world systems in the ten directions,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe'ang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe'ang /
translated: when the Bhagavān buddhas teach this perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: countless, innumerable sentient beings give rise to the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o ////
translated: This was the thirteenth chapter, “Subhūti,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na /
analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na /
translated: Then in this world system of a billion worlds

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha ji snyed cig yod pa de dag @536b thams cad kyang /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha ji snyed cig yod pa de dag @536b thams cad kyang /
translated: all the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods

original: lha bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /
analyzed: lha bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /
translated: gathered together with many quintillions of gods in that very assembly.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: In this world system of a billion worlds

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /
translated: All the Śakras, lords of the gods, however many there are, also gathered in that very retinue, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: In the great trichiliocosm,

original: lha'i bu rab mtshe ma ji snyed yod pa dang / lha'i bu rab dga' ldan ji snyed yod pa dang / lha'i bu rab 'phrul dga' ji snyed yod pa dang / lha'i bu rab gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /
analyzed: lha'i bu rab mtshe ma ji snyed yod pa dang / lha'i bu rab dga' ldan ji snyed yod pa dang / lha'i bu rab 'phrul dga' ji snyed yod pa dang / lha'i bu rab gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /
translated: all the Sunirmita gods, all the Saṃtuṣita gods, all the Nirmāṇarati gods, and all the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, however many there are, also gathered in that very retinue, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: In the great trichiliocosm,

original: tshangs pa ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: tshangs pa ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: all the Brahmās, however many there are, also gathered in that very retinue, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of Brahmās.

original: lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /
analyzed: lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur /
translated: and many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of devas were also gathered in that assembly.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: All the devas from the great trichiliocosm,

original: gnas gtsang ma'i bar gyi lha'i bu ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i bar gyi lha'i bu ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: up to the Śuddhāvāsa devas,

original: lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te /🔽rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang / mtshe ma'i lha dang / dga' ldan gyi lha dang / 'phrul dga'i lha dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang / mtshe ma'i lha dang / dga' ldan gyi lha dang / 'phrul dga'i lha dang /
translated: were also gathered in that assembly, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of devas.🔽The light of the bodies of the devas of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm that arises from the ripening of karma,

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang @537a *//
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang @537a *//
translated: the light of the bodies of the devas of the Trāyastriṃśa, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇa­rata, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realms,

original: byed kyi lha dang / tshangs ris kyi lha dang / kun snang dang ba'i lha dang / dge rgyas kyi lha dang / 'bras bu che ba'i lha dang / gnas gtsang ma'i lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa de dag gis /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar ma song /
analyzed: byed kyi lha dang / tshangs ris kyi lha dang / kun snang dang ba'i lha dang / dge rgyas kyi lha dang / 'bras bu che ba'i lha dang / gnas gtsang ma'i lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa de dag gis / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar ma song /
translated: the light of their bodies, which is born from the maturation of their karma,🔽does not approach even a hundredth part of the light of the Tathāgata’s nature.🔽It does not approach even a thousandth part.

original: stong gi char yang nye bar ma song /🔽brgya stong gi char yang nye bar ma song /
analyzed: stong gi char yang nye bar ma song / brgya stong gi char yang nye bar ma song /
translated: It does not approach even a hundred thousandth part.🔽It does not approach even a one hundred thousandth part of a one hundred thousandth part.

original: bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char yang nye bar ma song /
analyzed: bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char yang nye bar ma song /
translated: It does not approach even a koṭīniyutaśatasahasraṃth part.

original: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dper yang ma bzod do /
analyzed: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dper yang ma bzod do /
translated: It does not approach even a count, or a fraction, or a comparison, or an example.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:🔽For example,

original: dper na; 'dzam bu na da'i gser gyi drung na /
analyzed: dper na; 'dzam bu na da'i gser gyi drung na /
translated: in the presence of gold from the Jambū River,

original: lcags nag po'am /
analyzed: lcags nag po'am /
translated: black iron🔽is not radiant,🔽not bright,

original: mgal dum lham me ma yin /🔽lhan ne ma yin /🔽lhang nge ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mgal dum lham me ma yin /🔽lhan ne ma yin /🔽lhang nge ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: and not clear.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi drung na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi drung na /
translated: In the presence of the Tathāgata’s natural light,🔽all the lights born from the ripening of the devas’ karma

original: lha'i las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'od de dag thams cad lha ma me ma yin /
analyzed: lha'i las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'od de dag thams cad lha ma me ma yin /
translated: are not radiant,

original: lhan ne ma yin /
analyzed: lhan ne ma yin /
translated: not clear,🔽not bright,

original: lhang nge ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin gyi /
translated: but

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od 'ba' zhig de dag gi nang na dam par snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od 'ba' zhig de dag gi nang na dam par snang ngo //
translated: only the Tathāgata’s light appears supreme among them.

original: gtso bor snang ngo //🔽gya nom par snang ngo //
analyzed: gtso bor snang ngo // gya nom par snang ngo //
translated: It appears foremost,🔽it appears sublime,

original: 'phags par snang ngo //🔽mchog tu snang ngo //🔽rab tu snang ngo //
analyzed: 'phags par snang ngo // mchog tu snang ngo // rab tu snang ngo //
translated: it appears noble,🔽it appears excellent,🔽it appears radiant,

original: phul du snang ngo //🔽bla na med par snang ngo /
analyzed: phul du snang ngo // bla na med par snang ngo /
translated: it appears preeminent,🔽it appears unsurpassed,

original: gong na med par snang ngo //
analyzed: gong na med par snang ngo //
translated: it appears unsurpassable.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Devas,🔽said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti!

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten @537b gyi khams na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang / mtshe ma'i lha dang / dga' ldan gyi lha dang / 'phrul dga'i lha dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha dang /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten @537b gyi khams na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang / mtshe ma'i lha dang / dga' ldan gyi lha dang / 'phrul dga'i lha dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha dang /
translated: and the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma Heaven, the Tuṣita Heaven, the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin Heaven,

original: tshangs ris kyi lha dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtan la bab par bstan pa thos par 'dod nas /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtan la bab par bstan pa thos par 'dod nas /
translated: the Brahmakāyika gods, and so on up to the Śuddhāvāsa gods, all of them, wishing to hear the teaching of the definitive perfection of wisdom,

original: chos nyan par 'dod pa'i phyir lhags na //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /
analyzed: chos nyan par 'dod pa'i phyir lhags na // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /
translated: have come to listen to the Dharma.🔽How should a bodhisattva great being stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva great being?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar bslab par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar bslab par bya /
translated: How should a bodhisattva great being train in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Subhūti

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /🔽bam po nyi shu bdun pa /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa / bam po nyi shu bdun pa /
translated: said to Śakra, lord of the gods:

original: koo shi ka /🔽de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gyis shig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gyis shig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar bslab par bya ba @538a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar bslab par bya ba @538a *//
translated: therefore listen well and hard and pay attention, and I will tell you how the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of wisdom and how the bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom and how they should train in it,🔽by the power of the Buddha and the Buddha’s blessing.”

original: dang; lha'i bu gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma skyes pa de dag gis kyang /
analyzed: dang; lha'i bu gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma skyes pa de dag gis kyang /
translated: and those sons of gods who had not given rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect awakening also gave rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ba bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ba bstan par bya'o //
translated: and those sons of gods who have not yet given rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment should be taught to give rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: gang yang dag par skyon med par zhugs par gyur pa de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: gang yang dag par skyon med par zhugs par gyur pa de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med do //
translated: Those who have entered the faultless state do not have the power to give rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gis 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they have cut off the continuity of saṃsāra.

original: 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na de dag la'ang rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na de dag la'ang rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: However, if they were to give rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment, I would rejoice in that.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams 'thob par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams 'thob par 'gyur bas /
translated: Because they would attain qualities that are superior to the qualities that are superior.

original: de dag gis dge ba'i phyogs la bdag ni bar chad mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis dge ba'i phyogs la bdag ni bar chad mi byed do //
translated: They do not create obstacles for me in relation to wholesome actions.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings, with the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //

translated: and to form as painful, as without a self, as calm, as empty, as signless, as wishless, as afflicted, as purified, as having no basis, as having no foundation, as having no support, as having no origination, as having no cessation, as having no affliction, as having no purification, as having no production, as having no stopping, as having no greed, as having no hatred, as having no confusion, as having no form, as having no feeling, as having no perception, as having no volitional factors, as having no consciousness, as having no eyes, as having no ears, as having no nose, as having no tongue, as having no body, as having no mind, as having no form, as having no sound, as having no smell, as having no taste, as having no tangibles, as having no dharmas, as having no eyes constituent, as having no up to no mind consciousness constituent, as having no form realm, as having no up to no non-perceptual realm, as having no earth element, as having no up to no space element, as having no ignorance, as having no up to no old age and death, as having no suffering, as having no origin, as having no stopping, as having no path, as having no knowledge, as having no attainment, as having no non-attainment.

original: mi brtan pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang; 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: mi brtan pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang; 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: He should contemplate feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as impermanent, as suffering, as selfless, as calm, as empty, as signless, as wishless, as void, as not increasing, as not diminishing, as not entities, as not nonentities, as not coming, as not going, as not born, as not arising, as not produced, as not conditioned, as not manifest, as not not manifest, as not defiled, as not undefiled, as not liberated, as not not liberated, as not past, as not future, as not present, as not internal, as not external, as not gross, as not subtle, as not good, as not bad, as not defiled, as not purified, as not worldly, as not unworldly, as not mundane, as not supramundane, as not subject to affliction, as not unsubject to affliction, as not compounded, as not uncompounded, as not to be abandoned, as not not

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas; de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //🔽mig ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / na ba dang / dgra dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas; de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o // mig ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / na ba dang / dgra dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang /
translated: “They should pay attention to the eye, thinking of it as impermanent,

original: 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung pa dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung pa dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: and they should pay attention to the eye, thinking of it as suffering, as without self, as calm, as void, as diseased, as a boil, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as a plague, as a calamity, as an affliction, as empty, as without self, as unreliable, and as dangerous,🔽but they should do so with an attention that is not attached to anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang @539a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang @539a *//
translated: “They should pay attention to the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body,

original: yid ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: yid ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //
translated: and the thinking mind, thinking of it as impermanent,

original: yid ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / na ba dang / dgra dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang /
analyzed: yid ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / na ba dang / dgra dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang /
translated: The mind is suffering, selfless, peaceful, void, a disease, a boil, a dart, evil, an affliction, an enemy, subject to destruction, unstable,

original: 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: frightening, a disease, empty, insubstantial, untrustworthy, and harmful.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: With a mind that is generated in connection with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //
translated: he should attend to form as impermanent,

original: gzugs ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / na ba dang / dgra dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / na ba dang / dgra dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang /
translated: and to form as suffering, selfless, peaceful, void, a disease, a boil, a dart, evil, an affliction, an enemy, subject to destruction, unstable,🔽frightening, a disease, empty, insubstantial, untrustworthy, and harmful.

original: 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //

original: mi brtan pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: mi brtan pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: “He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the knowledge of paths,🔽without apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the perfection of giving,🔽without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration,🔽and the perfection of wisdom,🔽without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the applications of mindfulness,🔽without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the right efforts,🔽the legs of miraculous power,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,🔽the seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽and the noble eightfold path,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the ten powers of a tathāgata,🔽the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the perfection of giving,🔽without apprehending anything.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang; gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang; gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //
translated: He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration,🔽and the perfection of wisdom,

original: rga shi ni sdug bsngal ba dang; bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / na ba dang / dgra dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang /
analyzed: rga shi ni sdug bsngal ba dang; bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / nad dang / shu ba dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / na ba dang / dgra dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang /
translated: without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the applications of mindfulness,🔽without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the right efforts,🔽the legs of miraculous power,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,🔽the seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽and the noble eightfold path,🔽without apprehending anything.🔽He should contemplate the thought of impermanence with regard to the ten powers of a tathāgata,🔽the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽without apprehending anything.

original: 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag gi med pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: He should contemplate them as impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless, as having no master, as being unreliable, and as being harmful.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /🔽ma rig pa 'gag pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis / ma rig pa 'gag pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
translated: In the same way, with a thought endowed with the knowledge of all modes, he should contemplate them as not apprehended,🔽as the cessation of ignorance, of the impulses, of consciousness, of name-and-form, of the six sense fields, of contact, of feeling, of craving, of grasping, of becoming, of birth,🔽of old age and death, of sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and despair,

original: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa 'gag pa @542a *//🔽ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //
