original: de bzhin du zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par yid la bya'o //
translated: solitude, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and the absence of any basis for the performance of action.

original: koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: koo shi ka / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Kauśika,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being, with a thought that is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, should practice the perfection of giving without apprehending anything.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: With a thought that is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, he should practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom without apprehending anything.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva great being, with the mind of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom mo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom mo //
translated: cultivates the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: with the mind of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom mo //
translated: he cultivates the four right efforts, the four legs of magical emanation, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems @542b bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems @542b bskyed pas /
translated: with the mind of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: He cultivates the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang; ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang; ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the five clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang; snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom mo //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang; snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom mo //
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: they train correctly in the following way:

original: chos rnams mngon par rlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su rgyas par byed pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa de dag ni chos kho nar zad de /
analyzed: chos rnams mngon par rlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su rgyas par byed pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa de dag ni chos kho nar zad de /
translated: ‘Those that moisten, fully moisten, fully perfect, fully expand, and fully analyze phenomena are nothing but phenomena.

original: de la bdag gam bdag gi med do //
analyzed: de la bdag gam bdag gi med do //
translated: There is no self or mine in that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: Because the thought of dedication of the bodhisattva great beings is not accompanied by the thought of awakening,

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin te /
translated: and the thought of awakening is not accompanied by the thought of dedication.

original: @543a *// koo shi ka /
analyzed: @543a *// koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: The thought of dedication is not in the thought of enlightenment, nor is the thought of enlightenment in the thought of dedication.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs te /
translated: The thought of enlightenment is not in the thought of dedication, nor is the thought of dedication in the thought of enlightenment.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gang de ltar chos thams cad la'ang rab tu rtog la /
analyzed: gang de ltar chos thams cad la'ang rab tu rtog la /
translated: when one thus realizes all dharmas,

original: chos gang la'ang rnam par rgyu ba med pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang rnam par rgyu ba med pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and does not move around in any dharma at all, this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang // lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang // lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, then said to venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /🔽ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor / ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti,🔽how is the thought of dedication not accompanied by the thought of enlightenment?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: How is the thought of enlightenment not accompanied by the thought of dedication?

original: ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: How is the thought of dedicating to the thought of awakening not existent and not apprehended?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: How is the thought of awakening not existent and not apprehended in the thought of dedicating?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin /
translated: the thought of dedicating is not a thought.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin te /
translated: The thought of awakening is also not a thought.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Thus, that which is not a thought is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /🔽sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin par yang yongs su bsngo ba med /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste / sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin par yang yongs su bsngo ba med /
translated: That which is inconceivable is not a thought.🔽That which is not a thought does not dedicate that which is not a thought.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang bsam @543b gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsngo ba med de /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang bsam @543b gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsngo ba med de /
translated: The inconceivable does not dedicate the inconceivable.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Thus, that which is not a thought is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is inconceivable is not the mind.

original: gang de ltar chos thams cad la'ang so sor rtog la /
analyzed: gang de ltar chos thams cad la'ang so sor rtog la /
translated: One should investigate all phenomena in this way.

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pha med cing mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pha med cing mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
translated: One should not settle down on any phenomenon, and one should not apprehend any phenomenon.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Lord

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
translated: said to the venerable Subhūti:🔽“Subhūti, you who teach the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing mos pa skyed pa legs so //🔽legs so // rab 'byor /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing mos pa skyed pa legs so // legs so // rab 'byor /
translated: to bodhisattva great beings and generate enthusiasm for it, good, good!

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Subhūti, good, good!

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: bdag gis ni bka' drin dran par bgyis te //
analyzed: bdag gis ni bka' drin dran par bgyis te //
translated: I have remembered your kindness

original: bka' drin mi dran par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: bka' drin mi dran par mi bgyi'o //
translated: and I will not forget it.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: It is because in the past, when the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones were present,

original: de dag gi nyan thos de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan par bgyis te /
analyzed: de dag gi nyan thos de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan par bgyis te /
translated: the hearers of those [Buddhas] instructed and taught the six perfections to the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones when they were bodhisattvas.

original: dgyes pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / legs par gzengs bstod pa dang / rab tu dgyes pa dang / @544a *//
analyzed: dgyes pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / legs par gzengs bstod pa dang / rab tu dgyes pa dang / @544a *//
translated: They delighted them, inspired them, greatly rejoiced them,

original: bzhag pa dang / shin tu brtan par bgyis pas /
analyzed: bzhag pa dang / shin tu brtan par bgyis pas /
translated: established them, and made them very firm.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: When they were bodhisattvas in the past,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab pa mdzad de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab pa mdzad de /
translated: they trained in the six perfections,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: and the Blessed One fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams par bgyi'o //
translated: In the same way, I will instruct the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the six perfections.

original: rjes su bstan par bgyi'o //🔽dga' bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan par bgyi'o // dga' bar bgyi'o //
translated: I will teach them.🔽I will delight them.

original: yang dag par bskul bar bgyi'o //🔽legs par gzengs bstod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul bar bgyi'o // legs par gzengs bstod par bgyi'o //
translated: I will encourage them.🔽I will satisfy them.

original: rab tu dga' bar bgyi'o //🔽dgong par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar bgyi'o // dgong par bgyi'o //
translated: I will make them rejoice.🔽I will make them understand.

original: shin tu brtan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: shin tu brtan par bgyi'o //
translated: I will make them firm.

original: bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la de ltar gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / dga' bar bgyis pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / legs par gzengs bstod pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la de ltar gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / dga' bar bgyis pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / legs par gzengs bstod pa dang /
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas whom I have instructed, taught, delighted, encouraged, satisfied,

original: rab tu dga' bar bgyis pa dang / 'god pa dang / shin tu brtan pa dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar bgyis pa dang / 'god pa dang / shin tu brtan pa dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and made firm in the six perfections will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti🔽

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said:

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu @544b phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar mi gnas par bya ba bdag gis bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu @544b phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar mi gnas par bya ba bdag gis bshad do //
translated: therefore listen well and bear this in mind, I will explain how bodhisattva mahāsattvas should stand in the perfection of wisdom and how they should not stand.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: form is empty of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na gzugs stong pa nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs stong pa nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de /
translated: Form is empty of form, feeling is empty of feeling, perception is empty of perception, volitional factors are empty of volitional factors, and consciousness is empty of consciousness.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
translated: further, the eye is empty of the eye,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong ngo; ;byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong ngo; ;byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind is empty of the thinking mind, and a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na mig stong pa nyid dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mig stong pa nyid dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: thus the emptiness of the eye, the emptiness of the ear, the emptiness of the nose, the emptiness of the tongue, the emptiness of the body, the emptiness of the thinking mind, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: further, form is empty of form.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos ni chos kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos ni chos kyis stong ngo //
translated: Sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects are empty of mental objects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na gzugs stong pa nyid dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos stong pa nyid @545a *//
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs stong pa nyid dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos stong pa nyid @545a *//
translated: thus the emptiness of form, the emptiness of sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects,

original: dang; byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: dang; byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas stong ngo /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas stong ngo /
translated: further, the eye consciousness is empty of the eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: The ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness are empty of the mind consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: in this way, the emptiness of the eye consciousness, the emptiness of the ear consciousness, the emptiness of the nose consciousness, the emptiness of the tongue consciousness, the emptiness of the body consciousness, and the emptiness of the mind consciousness,

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: “Furthermore, the coming together and contact of the eye is empty of the coming together and contact of the eye.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: The coming together and contact of the ear, the coming together and contact of the nose, the coming together and contact of the tongue, the coming together and contact of the body, and the coming together and contact of the mind is empty of the coming together and contact of the mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,🔽in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes, the emptiness of the sensory element of sights, and the emptiness of the sensory element of visual consciousness are not two and cannot be divided into two.🔽Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the ears, the emptiness of sounds, and the emptiness of the sensory element of auditory consciousness are not two and cannot be divided into two.🔽Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the nose, the emptiness of odors, and the emptiness of the sensory element of olfactory consciousness are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: de ltar na mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus @545b te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus @545b te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the tongue, the emptiness of tastes, and the emptiness of the sensory element of gustatory consciousness are not two and cannot be divided into two.🔽Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the body, the emptiness of tangibles, and the emptiness of the sensory element of tactile consciousness are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su bya ra med do //🔽koo shi ka; gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su bya ra med do // koo shi ka; gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
translated: Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the mental faculty, the emptiness of mental phenomena, and the emptiness of the sensory element of mental consciousness are not two and cannot be divided into two.🔽Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes, the emptiness of the sensory element of sights, the emptiness of the sensory element of visual consciousness, and the emptiness of the sensory element of visual contact are not two and cannot be divided into two.🔽Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the ears, the emptiness of sounds, the emptiness of the sensory element of auditory consciousness, and the emptiness of the sensory element of auditory contact are not two and cannot be divided into two.🔽Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the nose, the emptiness of odors, the emptiness of the sensory element of olfactory consciousness, and the emptiness of the sensory element of olfactory contact are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
translated: Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the tongue, the emptiness of tastes, the emptiness of the sensory element of gustatory consciousness, and the emptiness of the sensory element of gustatory contact are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni /
translated: Kauśika, in this way, the emptiness of the sensory element of the body

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
translated: It is empty of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /🔽lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: in this way, the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact,

original: koo shi ka /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //🔽koo shi ka /
translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of body contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of thinking-mind contact, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: gzhan @546a *// yang sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan @546a *// yang sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
translated: Moreover, the earth element is empty of the earth element.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
translated: The water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are empty of the consciousness element.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na sa'i khams stong pa nyid dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sa'i khams stong pa nyid dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: thus the emptiness of the earth element, the emptiness of the water element, the emptiness of the fire element, the emptiness of the wind element, the emptiness of the space element, the emptiness of the consciousness element, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: thus should bodhisattva great beings stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong ngo //
translated: Moreover, ignorance is empty of ignorance.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni rga shis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni rga shis stong ngo //
translated: Conditioned action, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, and old age and death are empty of old age and death.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /🔽de ltar na ma rig pa stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang /🔽skye @546b ba dang / rga shi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: koo shi ka / de ltar na ma rig pa stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye @546b ba dang / rga shi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Kauśika,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: in this way, the emptiness of ignorance, the emptiness of conditioned action, the emptiness of consciousness, the emptiness of name and form, the emptiness of the six sense sources, the emptiness of contact, the emptiness of feeling, the emptiness of craving, the emptiness of appropriation, the emptiness of existence, the emptiness of birth, the emptiness of old age and death, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa 'gags pa ni ma rig pa 'gags pas stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa 'gags pa ni ma rig pa 'gags pas stong ngo //
translated: further, the cessation of ignorance is empty of the cessation of ignorance.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi 'gags pa ni rga shi 'gags pas stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi 'gags pa ni rga shi 'gags pas stong ngo //
translated: Similarly, the cessation of volitional factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense fields, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, and old age and death is empty of the cessation of old age and death.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa 'gags pa stong pa nyid dang / rga shi 'gags pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa 'gags pa stong pa nyid dang / rga shi 'gags pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the cessation of ignorance, the emptiness of the cessation of old age and death, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and are not divided.”

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: “Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: koo shi ka /

translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom is empty of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //

analyzed: koo shi ka /

analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa'i @547a *//

translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the noble eightfold path are empty of the noble eightfold path.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //

analyzed: koo shi ka; 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: “Kauśika, the four noble truths are empty of the four noble truths, the four formless absorptions are empty of the four formless absorptions, the eight deliverances are empty of the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions are empty of the nine serial absorptions,🔽the ten tathāgata powers are empty of the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses are empty of the four fearlessnesses,

translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges are empty of the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: the bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva.

analyzed: koo shi ka / de ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa stong pa nyid dang / sangs @548a *//

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: the bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,
